author: wsjcom
title: Corrections & Amplifications
text:
0 COMMENTS President Donald Trump spoke Thursday to Fox News about a future nominee to lead the Veterans Affairs Department. In some editions on Friday, a U.S. News article about Rear Adm. Ronny Jackson withdrawing as a nominee omitted the word News from the channel’s name.
First-quarter sales in the Intel Corp. division responsible for server chips and other data-center gear rose 24%. A Technology article Friday about Intel’s results incorrectly said the rise was 25%.
Shares of Wells Fargo & Co. fell 1.3% on Thursday. A Markets article on Friday about Thursday’s stock trading incorrectly said the shares fell 0.7%.
Pacific Investment Management Co.’s name was incorrectly given as Pacific Investment Co. in a Page One article Wednesday about Pimco.
Berkshire Hathaway Inc. Class A stock closed at $300,140 on April 20, down $160. The Biggest 1000 Stocks listing on April 21 incorrectly gave the price as $298,450 and the net change as -$1,850. The listings published March 20, 27, 28, 30; April 3-5; April 7, 10; and April 12-20 also contained incorrect price and net change data for the previous days’ trading of BRK.A. Here is a table of the correct data:
Prince died on April 21, 2016. An April 25 Arts in Review story about a festival celebrating the musician, “The Man Behind the Purple Veil,” misstated the date.
Readers can alert The Wall Street Journal to any errors in news articles by emailing wsjcontact@wsj.com or by calling 888-410-2667.
